document.masterDocTitle: Review of the genus Termioptycha Meyrick, 1889 (Lepidoptera, Pyralidae) from China, with descriptions of four new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Review of the genus Termioptycha Meyrick, 1889 (Lepidoptera, Pyralidae) from China, with descriptions of four new species

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Ethnistis eucarta
Felder & Rogenhofer, 1875 : 28
. TL: Indonesia ( Moluccas ).
Termioptycha cyanopa
Meyrick, 1889 : 505
. TL: New Guinea .

Sialocyttara erasta
Turner, 1913 : 134
. TL: Australia (Queensland).
Termioptycha distantia
Inoue, 1982 : 378
. TL: Japan (Iriomote).

Diagnosis. Adult ( Fig. 12 ) wingspan 24.0–31.0 mm. This species is diagnostic in the male genitalia by the gnathos having a setose sub-rounded median process ( Fig. 22 ), in the female genitalia by the paired elongate ovate signa with smaller one no more than 1/2 the length of the larger one ( Fig. 28 ).
Termioptycha eucarta
is similar to
T. longiclavata
sp. nov.
in both forewing pattern and male genitalia, and the differences between the two species are given under the former species.

Distribution. China ( Guangdong , Guangxi , Henan , Jiangxi , Jilin , Liaoning , Shaanxi , Shanxi , Sichuan , Taiwan , Zhejiang ); Japan , Indonesia , Australia ,
Papua New Guinea
.
Notes. This species is newly recorded in China.

Remarks. Ethnistis is the synonym of the genus
Bonchis Walker, 1862
, belonging to the subfamily Chrysauginae. Solis (1992) transferred
Ethnistis eucarta Felder & Rogenhofer, 1875
to
Termioptycha
, which has a characteristic apical spine of the costa as in other species of the genus in the male genitalia.
